metadata.name: Skeleton
metadata.description:
In Skeleton, athletes lie prone on it with heads forward and feet behind, then dive down from the top. Speed of skeleton is so high, up to 135 kilometers per hour, that it is labeled as 'F1 on ice'. Athletes in this paper cutting are focusing on this super dangerous competition and trying to challenge human physical limits.
 The paper-cut of Yu county is named after the traditional handicraft of paper cutting in Yu County, Hebei Province. It is on the Intangible Cultural Heritage List nationwide and worldwide. 
 Gao Dianliang is the founding person of Chinese paper-cut paintings, and the representative  inheritor of the paper-cut of Yu county, an intangible cultural heritage worldwide. He is highly praised by the UNESCO for his talent and artistry for paper cutting. As a guest professor of the Central Academy of Fine Arts in Beijing and a member of the experts group for the commemorative coins of 2022 Winter Olympics, he was invited in 2017 by the Organizing Committee for the Olympic Winter Games to create the paper-cut of the emblems of the 2022 Olympic and Paralympic Winter Games.
